Class PointlikeBody

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      PointlikeBody
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GravityField, RectangularIsolatorSpace
public class PointlikeBody
extends Thread

This object is the basic physical object that can be created in the PHY software.

It represents a point like body with mass, position and velocity. The body has no dimensions, it is like a point in mathematics.

This objects lives its life independently. Whenever play is set in its PHYModel object, it calculates its position and velocity from time to time, depending on the surroundig conditions.

Field Detail

m

protected double m
Mass of the body, measured in kilograms.

name

protected String name
Name of the body.

p

protected Dimension p
Position of the body, measured in meters, relative to the center of a mathematical coordinate system.

phymodel

protected PHYModel phymodel
The model, holding addresses of all other bodies, spaces and forces.

The body will be able to connect to other forces and fields if it sees them. Their addresses are stored in a class PHYModel. Only one instance of this object should be allocated, and assinged to all living bodies, in order to make them visible to each other.

v

protected Dimension v
Velocity vector of the body, measured in meters/seconds.

Constructor Detail

PointlikeBody

PointlikeBody(double m,
              Dimension p,
              Dimension v,
              PHYModel phymodel,
              String name)
Perfect definition of the object.

It gets the main attributes, and also an instance of the PHYModel class. Very important to use this constructor and to specify the phymodel object. Otherwise the body will have no connection to other objects, declared to live inside a different system.

Parameters:
m - mass to be assigned
p - position to be assigned
v - speed to be assigned
phymodel - the model object which holds all the other bodies
name - name to be assigned
Method Detail

calculateActingForces

protected Dimension calculateActingForces()
Returns the resulting force acting on the body.

Scans through all the forces and all the spaces. Determines a set of spaces in which the body is inside. Determines a set of forces that are inside the same set of spaces as the body. Adds those forces together.

Returns:
a Dimension object representing the resulting force acting on the body

isInsideRIS

protected boolean isInsideRIS(Dimension p,
                              RectangularIsolatorSpace ris)
Checks if the point p is inside the RectangularIsolatorSpace ris.

Parameters:
p - point to be checked
ris - the RectangularIsolatorSpace to which the point is compared
Returns:
true if inside, false otherwise

run

public void run()
If the playback is on, this method calculates a new position and a new velocity of the body from time to time.

Time is recorded before and after the Thread.sleep(int) command. By subtracting one from the other we get the time elapsed. This is because sleepTime is not always perfectly as long as specified. In function of that elapsed time and body's other attributes, it calculates its new position and velocity.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
Overrides:
run in class Thread
